result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Matter set for a PTC on 12/19/2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Notice of hearing 10/31/22 at 10:30am - Return to sender insufficient address unable to forward
Order on Defendant's Motion to Appear via ZOOM for Pretrial Hearing /s/ PB 09/14/22
Order on Defendant's Motion to Appear By ZOOM at Pretrial Hearing filed by Atty Nathan Oswald (sent to Br 3 Judge on 09/14/22 sp)
Defendant's Motion to Appear By ZOOM at Pretrial Hearing filed by Atty Nathan Oswald (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 09/14/22 sp)

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

4:34 PM Defendant Christopher L Green appeared by video.  Attorney Nathan T Oswald in court for Christopher L Green.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
21CT81 is tracking with this CF case.

Court questions the Defendant with regards to the video conferencing he had discussed with the Br 2 Judge.

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear via ZOOM and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
Defendant indicates he understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his attorney.
BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily consenting to use of video conferencing. 

4:35 p.m.  Detective A Yenter is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Pfeil.
4:42 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
BY THE COURT: 
Record reflects that the witness identified the defendant.
Cross examination by Atty Oswald.
4:45 p.m.  Objection by ADA Pfeil.  Sustained.
4:46 p.m.  ADA Pfeil has no redirect.
Witness is excused.
ADA Pfeil has no additional witnesses or final argument.
Atty Oswald has no witnesses and no final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

4:01 PM Defendant Christopher L Green appeared by video.  Attorney Nathan T Oswald in court for Christopher L Green.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear via ZOOM and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
Defendant indicates he understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his attorney.
BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily consenting to use of telephonic conferencing. 

4:02 p.m.  Detective A Yenter is sworn in.
Court questions Atty Oswald is informed by the Court that he technically is ineligible to sit on this case unless both parties are willing to waive the non recusal of the Court.
4:03 p.m.  All parties in the courtroom leave so that Atty Oswald may have an opportunity to speak with his client.
Defendant is requesting that this be reassigned to another court.
This is a Br 3 case - Court informs the parties that Judge Zell may be able to hear this case.  
Bailiff will check to see if Judge Zell is still in the building.

BY THE COURT: 
Court will need to recuse himself from this preliminary hearing.
Preliminary Hearing is rescheduled.
Bond is continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Request for Discovery filed by Atty Nathan T Oswald
Atty Nathan Oswald appointed

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner (sent to Br 3 Judge on 08/16/22 sp)
Preliminary Hearing set for 08/15/22- not deliverable as addressed

4:08 PM Defendant Christopher L Green appeared by video.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Christopher L Green. 
21CT81 is tracking with 22CF107.

Atty Bergner indicates that he will have a conflict of interest if he remains on the case.
Atty Bergner would ask to withdraw and would have another attorney appointed.
Atty Bergner will file a motion/order to withdraw.
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant did not know about the issue that had been put on the record by Atty Bergner.
Defendant informed to contact the public defender's office to get a new public defender appointed.
Court questions Atty Bergner if he knows how long it may take - Atty Bergner states approx. 30 days.
Defendant is in agreement.
Time limits had been previously waived to have a preliminary hearing held.

BY THE COURT: 
Court will allow Atty Bergner to withdraw.
Motion/Order to be filed.
Bond is continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

4:10 PM Defendant Christopher L Green in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert Jambois appears on behalf of ADA Brian J Pfeil for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Christopher L Green. 

ADA Jambois states that his witness is not available for this Preliminary Hearing.

4:24 p.m.  ADA Jambois recalls this case.
Defendant Christopher L Green in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert Jambois appears on behalf of ADA Brian J Pfeil for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Christopher L Green
ADA Jambois states that he had subpoenaed Detective Yenter but is out with a medical issue.
ADA Jambois would ask that this be adjourned.
Atty Bergner states that his client has come from Indiana and would like to proceed.
Court makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
Preliminary Hearing to be rescheduled.
Defendant is able to appear via ZOOM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:12 PM Defendant Christopher L Green appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Christopher L Green. 

Court questions the defendant if he is able to see the parties.  He responds.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
ADA Mutchler would request a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Warrant Paperwork Returned from the Sheriff's Dept.
Matter set for an AIA on 6/20/2022 at 2:15 p.m. in Branch 2

2:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher L Green not in court. 
State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant with $500  cash alternative, statewide

filed by the State 
Initial Appearance set for May 2, 2022 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 2

2:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher L Green not in court.

Atty Mutchler requests a warrant with a $500 cash alternative.  Makes statements regarding service. 
Court reviews the file.  The summons has a different address than that in the complaint.  Questions if Atty Mutchler is confident that the Wautoma address is his current address. 
Atty Mutchler states he is unsure which address is correct.   Both were sent out at the same time.  

Court will adjourn the matter to have correct address determined.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Initial Appearance set for April 4, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 2
